name: ConceptMap
description: A statement of relationships from one set of concepts to one or more other concepts - either concepts in code systems, or data element/data element concepts, or classes in class models.

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this concept map, represented as a URI (globally unique)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this concept map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this concept map is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the concept map is stored on different servers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: identifier
elements.short: Additional identifier for the concept map
elements.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this concept map when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the concept map
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the concept map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the concept map author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this concept map (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the concept map. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Name for this concept map (human friendly)
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
elements.description: The status of this concept map. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this concept map is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.short: Date last changed
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the concept map was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the concept map changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.short: Contact details for the publisher
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the concept map
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the concept map from a consumer's perspective.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate concept map instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for concept map (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the concept map is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this concept map is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this concept map is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: copyright
elements.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the concept map and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: source[x]
elements.short: The source value set that contains the concepts that are being mapped
elements.description: Identifier for the source value set that contains the concepts that are being mapped and provides context for the mappings.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: target[x]
elements.short: The target value set which provides context for the mappings
elements.description: The target value set provides context for the mappings. Note that the mapping is made between concepts, not between value sets, but the value set provides important context about how the concept mapping choices are made.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: group
elements.short: Same source and target systems
elements.description: A group of mappings that all have the same source and target system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: source
elements.short: Source system where concepts to be mapped are defined
elements.description: An absolute URI that identifies the source system where the concepts to be mapped are defined.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: sourceVersion
elements.short: Specific version of the  code system
elements.description: The specific version of the code system, as determined by the code system authority.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: target
elements.short: Target system that the concepts are to be mapped to
elements.description: An absolute URI that identifies the target system that the concepts will be mapped to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: targetVersion
elements.short: Specific version of the  code system
elements.description: The specific version of the code system, as determined by the code system authority.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: element
elements.short: Mappings for a concept from the source set
elements.description: Mappings for an individual concept in the source to one or more concepts in the target.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: code
elements.short: Identifies element being mapped
elements.description: Identity (code or path) or the element/item being mapped.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: display
elements.short: Display for the code
elements.description: The display for the code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: target
elements.short: Concept in target system for element
elements.description: A concept from the target value set that this concept maps to.

constraints.human: If the map is narrower or inexact, there SHALL be some comments
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: code
elements.short: Code that identifies the target element
elements.description: Identity (code or path) or the element/item that the map refers to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: display
elements.short: Display for the code
elements.description: The display for the code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: equivalence
elements.short: relatedto | equivalent | equal | wider | subsumes | narrower | specializes | inexact | unmatched | disjoint
elements.description: The equivalence between the source and target concepts (counting for the dependencies and products). The equivalence is read from target to source (e.g. the target is 'wider' than the source).

binding.description: The degree of equivalence between concepts.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: comment
elements.short: Description of status/issues in mapping
elements.description: A description of status/issues in mapping that conveys additional information not represented in  the structured data.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: dependsOn
elements.short: Other elements required for this mapping (from context)
elements.description: A set of additional dependencies for this mapping to hold. This mapping is only applicable if the specified element can be resolved, and it has the specified value.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: property
elements.short: Reference to property mapping depends on
elements.description: A reference to an element that holds a coded value that corresponds to a code system property. The idea is that the information model carries an element somewhere that is labeled to correspond with a code system property.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: system
elements.short: Code System (if necessary)
elements.description: An absolute URI that identifies the code system of the dependency code (if the source/dependency is a value set that crosses code systems).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: value
elements.short: Value of the referenced element
elements.description: Identity (code or path) or the element/item/ValueSet/text that the map depends on / refers to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: display
elements.short: Display for the code (if value is a code)
elements.description: The display for the code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: product
elements.short: Other concepts that this mapping also produces
elements.description: A set of additional outcomes from this mapping to other elements. To properly execute this mapping, the specified element must be mapped to some data element or source that is in context. The mapping may still be useful without a place for the additional data elements, but the equivalence cannot be relied on.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: unmapped
elements.short: What to do when there is no mapping for the source concept
elements.description: What to do when there is no mapping for the source concept. "Unmapped" does not include codes that are unmatched, and the unmapped element is ignored in a code is specified to have equivalence = unmatched.

constraints.human: If the mode is 'fixed', a code must be provided
If the mode is 'other-map', a url must be provided
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: mode
elements.short: provided | fixed | other-map
elements.description: Defines which action to take if there is no match for the source concept in the target system designated for the group. One of 3 actions are possible: use the unmapped code (this is useful when doing a mapping between versions, and only a few codes have changed), use a fixed code (a default code), or alternatively, a reference to a different concept map can be provided (by canonical URL).

binding.description: Defines which action to take if there is no match in the group.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.short: Fixed code when mode = fixed
elements.description: The fixed code to use when the mode = 'fixed'  - all unmapped codes are mapped to a single fixed code.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: display
elements.short: Display for the code
elements.description: The display for the code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: url
elements.short: canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap to use for mapping if the source concept is unmapped
elements.description: The canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap resource instance to use for mapping if this ConceptMap resource contains no matching mapping for the source concept.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
